title: In how many different ways can a student answer a 10-question true-false test, if half the answers must be T and half the answers must be F? - Quora

response.answer_text: Generally, if you have 10 things to be arranged, there are 10! arrangements. As 5 are T and 5 are F, you must divide by 5!*5!. Hence, there ate 10!/(5!*5!) = 252.

This boils down to how many ways can you nominate 5 positions from 10 (to be marked True). The other positions marked False follow automatically. So that is 10x9x8x7x6/(5x4x3x2x1) which is 2x9x7x2=252 (if I did my mental arithmetic correctly).
